name: Buspirone (Buspar)
summary: An anxiolytic primarily used for the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), distinct from benzodiazepines in its mechanism and side effect profile.
description: Buspirone is a non-benzodiazepine anxiolytic that functions as a serotonin 5-HT1A partial agonist with some dopamine D2 receptor affinity. It is indicated for generalized anxiety disorder and is valued for its non-sedating, non-habit-forming properties. Buspirone does not provide immediate relief and is ineffective for acute anxiety episodes, but is effective in chronic anxiety management.

sections.text: Acts as a partial agonist at serotonin 5-HT1A receptors and has moderate affinity for dopamine D2 receptors, leading to anxiolytic effects without sedation or dependence.

adult.start: 7.5 mg twice daily or 5 mg three times daily
adult.titrate: Increase by 5 mg/day every 2–3 days as tolerated

sections.geriatric: Start at lower doses (5 mg twice daily) and titrate slowly
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; lower doses may be required
sections.renal_impairment: Use with caution in severe impairment

items: Tablets: 5 mg, 7.5 mg, 10 mg, 15 mg, 30 mg

sections.text: Therapeutic effect usually requires 2–4 weeks; not effective for immediate relief.

sections.pregnancy: Generally considered safe; use if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in breast milk; monitor infant
sections.geriatrics: Often well tolerated; start with lower doses

sections.text: No taper required; can be stopped abruptly without withdrawal.
